question: Which country houses "Urho Kekkonen National Park"?
explanation: Urho Kekkonen National Park is an IUCN Category II national park located in the Lapland region of Finland. This park, which got established in 1983, is one of Finland's largest protected areas and named after Urho Kekkonen, former president and Prime Minister of Finland. Reindeer herding is one of the common livelihoods in this area of the national park.
